page.title: 06BUTTERLEIGH POST OFFICE
page.content: The person who runs the post office in Butterleigh has lived there since 1966, but the post office did not open until 1972.The post is collected only once a day by mail van and then taken first to Cullompton, before going to the main sorting office in Exeter. It is also delivered by mail van - this is because the farms and houses in the area are so spread out. Although the post office used to sell more, it is now very small and only sells stamps. On average, fifteen to twenty customers are served per day.
